messages.content: My YT-2400 freighter's hyperdrive is failing mid-jump. What do I do?

A failing hyperdrive mid-jump is serious! First, check your motivator—it might be overheating. If you have an astromech droid, run a diagnostic on the primary power couplings. Otherwise, revert to realspace and attempt a cold reboot of the navicomputer. If the issue persists, bring your ship to the nearest Hyperdrive Solutions service station—we have technicians stationed at major spaceports like Nar Shaddaa and Coruscant.
I just installed a Kuat Shield Generator on my starfighter, but it's draining power from my weapons. Any advice?

That’s a common issue when installing high-powered shield generators on smaller craft. Check your ship’s power distribution settings—if you have an R-series astromech, you can adjust power allocation in-flight. Otherwise, consider upgrading your power cells or installing a capacitor buffer to balance energy flow. If you need custom modifications, our certified technicians at the Corellian Shipyards can assist!
My droid co-pilot refuses to engage the sublight engines. Keeps saying 'Protocol Error 327-TK'—what does that mean?

Protocol Error 327-TK usually indicates a misalignment between your droid's command protocols and the ship’s flight computer. Try resetting the droid's interface module by performing a hard reboot—hold down its primary power switch for 10 seconds. If the issue persists, it might be a compatibility issue with your ship’s firmware. Bring it to one of our service stations, or try updating your flight software via the Holonet.
I ordered a replacement ion thruster for my T-65 X-Wing, but I received a TIE fighter engine instead. What gives?

We apologize for the mix-up! It seems like there was an error at our Imperial Surplus Warehouse. Please send your order number, and we’ll have the correct ion thruster shipped to you at lightspeed. In the meantime, don’t try installing that TIE engine—it’s not compatible with Rebel designs, and you might accidentally attract Imperial attention!
Do you offer extended warranties on your modified YT-1300 light freighter packages?

Yes, we do! Our standard warranty covers primary drive systems for 5 standard years, but if you opt for our 'Smuggler’s Special' package, you get a 10-year warranty on all hyperdrive modifications and shield enhancements. Keep in mind, though—unauthorized tinkering (like what Han Solo did to the *Millennium Falcon*) will void the warranty!
My YT-1300 freighter's hyperdrive is making a weird clanking noise before engaging. Is it about to fail?

That sounds like a misaligned hyperdrive motivator. If it's clanking, it might be loose or overheating. Shut down the system and check the mounting brackets. If you see any scorch marks, your motivator might be on its last jump. I recommend bringing it in for service at our nearest certified repair station—before you end up stranded in deep space!
My heavily modified N-1 Starfighter is burning through fuel at an alarming rate. Any suggestions?
Fuel consumption issues often occur after major modifications. Did you install upgraded thrusters or a non-standard hyperdrive?
Yeah, I swapped out the original drive for a Sienar-Class Micro-Jump Unit and added aftermarket sublight engines.
That explains it. Your new sublight engines likely have a higher thrust-to-fuel ratio. Plus, Sienar drives aren’t optimized for efficiency—those are built for quick, short-range jumps.
Is there a way to fix it without replacing the engines?

You can tweak your fuel injector settings and adjust your power distribution. If you have a control module, limit peak energy output to avoid unnecessary drain. You might also consider installing an auxiliary fuel regulator to smooth out consumption.
I’ll give that a shot. Where can I get a good fuel regulator?
We have Hyperdrive Solutions-certified regulators available at all major spaceports—check Mos Eisley, Nar Shaddaa, or Coruscant. Otherwise, I can place an order for you.
Thanks! I’ll see if I can find one locally first.
My ship’s long-range comms are picking up weird static, but only when I pass near uncharted space. Any ideas?
That could be interference from a gravitational anomaly or latent energy fields. Have you noticed any patterns in when it happens?
It seems to happen near old Imperial battlefields or derelict stations.

Ah, that makes sense. Many abandoned battlefields still have active energy signatures—old distress signals, encrypted transmissions, or even remnant droid activity. Some may even be jamming fields left over from past conflicts.
Is there a way to filter it out?
Try adjusting your comms array to narrowband mode and tune out high-frequency anomalies. If you have a signal scrambler, you can use it to block non-essential interference.
Would installing a new transceiver help?

Possibly, but it depends on the source of the interference. If it's a naturally occurring phenomenon, upgrading to a more advanced transceiver could help. However, if it’s artificial, like an old Imperial distress signal, you may need specialized decryption software to avoid unwanted signals.
Got it. I’ll try tweaking the settings first before upgrading. Thanks!
Our fleet upgrade budget is out of control. We ordered six Class-4 Hyperdrives, but the invoice is 25% higher than expected. Explain?
Let me review your order… Ah, I see. Your invoice includes expedited shipment through Hutt-controlled space and a mandatory fuel surcharge for transports passing near Imperial Remnant checkpoints.
We weren’t informed about those surcharges upfront. Can we dispute them?

Expedited shipment fees are non-refundable, but I can adjust future orders to avoid high-risk routes. If you have flexibility, we can re-route through New Republic-friendly trade lanes for lower costs on future shipments.
Noted. Apply the alternate route to our next bulk order.
Understood! I’ll update your account preferences to prioritize lower-cost shipping lanes. Let me know if you need a revised budget forecast for upcoming orders.
Our security firm is considering purchasing a squadron of KSE Firespray-class ships. Would leasing be a better financial option?
That depends on your long-term needs. Leasing offers lower upfront costs and maintenance coverage, but purchasing gives you full asset control and resale value.
What are the maintenance costs on a leased fleet?
For a standard 5-year lease, maintenance is covered up to 75,000 flight hours per unit. Any combat-related damage or illegal modifications void the coverage, though.
Illegal modifications? Define that.
Custom weapons, unauthorized engine tuning, or installing stealth tech from black-market sources—these all violate lease agreements. If you're running standard security ops, you should be fine.
Understood. I’ll discuss it with my board. If we buy outright, do you offer volume discounts?
Yes, bulk purchases of 10 or more ships qualify for a 12% discount. I can also arrange a financing plan if needed.
